resources.string: This word search software contains words compiled from website http://wordlist.sourceforge.net. Text file taken from this website is divided alphabetically and then encoded using Huffman Encoding( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huffman_coding). Encoded binary files are kept in res/raw folder and accessed depending on the first alphabet of the word being searched. They are decoded and if the entered word matches a word from the list then it is shown on screen with a beep.
Beep sound file taken from http://soundbible.com/grab.php?id=1682&type=mp3 website.
Thanks to Prof. Stephen Intille for suggesting the idea of encoding ASCII to binary and also the idea of using any encoding algorithm to compress the size of the data stored.
1) Phase 1 of the game has nine 3x3 grids which are all seeded with 9 letter words. Goal is to find a word in each grid. Finding nine letter word earns extra points.
2) In each 3x3 grid word can be formed using adjacent letters including diagonally adjacent letters and one cell can be selected only once.
3) After time ends or submit is clicked player can select one letter from each grid where word is found and proceed to phase 2.

4) In phase 2 of the game a 3x3 grid is formed using letters selected at the end of phase 1. Goal is to form words using adjacent letters. Each letter can be selected multiple times except that same letter cannot be selected twice in a row.
5) Phase 2 of the game gives five times the points as phase 1 but making same word or wrong words will deduct 30 points.
This game has background image from http://orig13.deviantart.net/fb06/f/2010/184/3/3/wood_by_renanluism.png.
Beep sound file taken from http://soundbible.com/grab.php?id=1682&type=mp3 website.
Thanks to Prof. Stephen Intille for helping in various design aspects of the game including seeding of words in 3x3 grid.

This app uses
 1. play-services-maps:10.2.0 for displaying the map
 2. firebase-messaging:10.2.0 for communication between phones
 3. firebase-database:10.2.0 for storing data
 4. Google Places API for generating pin suggestions
 5. App toolbar https://guides.codepath.com/android/Using-the-App-Toolbar 
 6. App previous dialog http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35732870/how-should-i-return-to-a-previous-dialog-from-another-one 


This app is tested on
 1. Motorola XT1052(Android 5.1, API 22)
 2. Nexus 5(Android 6.0, API 23)
 3. Nexus 5 API 16
 4. Nexus 5 API 25
 5. Kyocera C5155


Thanks to Prof. Stephen Intille for helping in refining the app idea
 Thanks to Aditya Batheja for lending phone for testing
 Thanks to Jojo Lee for helping with the app launcher icon

PinMe is a free location sharing application that connects you with your close friends and family. You can create your own definition of the location and share with people who matters the most to you.

 PinMe can also be a safety application. It is a tool for you to check on friends you follow and get an idea of what they are doing. It also allows you to request people you follow to share their location. 

 NOTE: this application requires Internet connection and uses your location data

 Features:
 * Allow user to create a unique user name
 * Request a permission to follow a person
 * Contain an imported google map
 * Use GPS sensor to indicate the location of the user
 * Send out the location request by notification

\ This game is played just like regular Tic Tac Toe with one difference: to win a tile you have to win a smaller game of Tic Tac Toe inside that tile.\n\ \n\ A tie happens when there are no further moves. In the case of a tie in a small board, that will count as a win for both sides in the larger game.
The Log Token button logs the Registration token to the log. The Send Notification Button sends the notification to the client device.
